title: Increases the earned income disregard and repeals the one hundred eighty-five percent standard of need for public assistance applicants; repealer
summary: Relates to monthly grants and allowances of public assistance; increases the earned income disregard to sixty-seven percent and repeals the one hundred eighty-five percent standard of need for public assistance applicants.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3425

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M. of A. WRIGHT, AUBRY, PEOPLES-STOKES, ROBINSON, TOWNS,
         CAMARA, CLARK, PERRY, PRETLOW -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. GLICK,
         JEFFRIES -- read once and referred to the Committee on Social Services

       AN ACT to amend the social services law, in relation to  increasing  the
         earned  income disregard and to repeal subdivision 10 of section 131-a
         of such law relating to the earned income cap of the standard of  need
         for public assistance applicants

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subparagraph (iii) of paragraph (a)  of  subdivision  8  of
    2  section  131-a  of the social services law, as amended by chapter 246 of
    3  the laws of 2002, is amended to read as follows:
    4    (iii) [forty-two] SIXTY-SEVEN percent of the earned  income  for  such
    5  month of any recipient in a household containing a dependent child which
    6  remains  after application of all other subparagraphs of this paragraph;
    7  provided, however, that such percentage amount shall be adjusted in June
    8  of each year, commencing in nineteen hundred  ninety-eight,  to  reflect
    9  changes  in  the  most  recently issued poverty guidelines of the United
   10  States Bureau of the Census, such that  a  household  of  three  without
   11  special needs, living in a heated apartment in New York city and without
   12  unearned  income would become ineligible for assistance with gross earn-
   13  ings equal to the poverty level in such guidelines;  provided,  however,
   14  that no assistance shall be given to any household with gross earned and
   15  unearned  income, exclusive of income described in subparagraphs (i) and
   16  (vi) of this paragraph, in excess of such poverty level;
   17    S 2. Subdivision 10 of section 131-a of the  social  services  law  is
   18  REPEALED.
   19    S  3.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   20  have become a law and shall apply to aid determined under public assist-
   21  ance programs in months beginning after such date.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
